code: @Manual{,   title = {DANA: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data},   author = {Yannick Düren and Johannes Lederer and Li-Xuan Qin},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.1.1}, }

what: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: DANA approach assessing performance normalization microRNA-Seq data based biology-motivated data-driven metrics. approach takes advantage well-known biological features microRNAs expression pattern polycistronic clustering assess (1) effectively normalization removes handling effects (2) normalization biases true biological signals. DANA implemented R can used assessing normalization method (minimal assumptions) microRNA-Seq data set requires additional information polycistronic clustering marker location genome, typically readily available. general, can apply DANA assessment normalization method long normalized counts non-negative. simplicity, provide eight commonly used normalization methods: Total Count (TC) Upper Quartile (UQ) Median (median) Trimmed Median Means (TMM) DESeq PoissonSeq Quantile Normalization (QN) Remove Unwanted Variation (subtypes: RUVg, RUVr, RUVs) normalization method study, DANA computes two assessment metrics: cc mcr: cc measures preservation biological signals versus normalization. high value indicates high preservation biological signals (cc <= 1). mcr measures relative reduction handling versus normalization. high mcr indicates higher removal handling effects. optimal normalization maximally removes handling effects (high mcr) keeping biological signals intact (cc close 1). However, cases, clear “best” method maximal mcr maximal cc. Therefore, one aim best possible trade-proposed statistics negative positive controls emphasis keeping biological signals intact (cc close 1). two metrics can easily assessed plotting metrics scatter plot (see function plotDANA) normalization method study, preferable method located towards top-right quadrant plot.

title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: can install released version DANA directly github using devtools :

title: Data-driven Normalization Assessment for miRNA-Seq Data
text: Users neet input raw count matrix RNA-Seq studies (without normalization transformation) information polycistronic clustering miRNAs. Clustering information can readily generated using defineClusters function miRNA chromosome location information (base-pair/nucleotide location) available. Assume raw.counts hold raw un-normalized count data row names correspond sample names column names correspond marker names. groups vector sample groups (e.g. sample sub-types). , chr loc provide information chromosome location marker raw.counts. First, normalize raw count data using provided normalization routine: Define polycistronic clusters miRNAs positive negative control markers. Adjust bounds positive negative controls data set, e.g. using helper plot functions plotMeanSD plotCountHist. Assess normalization data set:
code: normalized <- applyNormalization(   raw.counts,   groups,   method = c("TC", "UQ", "median", "TMM", "DESeq", "PoissonSeq", "QN", "RUV")) clusters <- defineClusters(colnames(raw.counts), chr, loc) controls <- defineControls(   raw.counts,    t.zero = 2,     # lower count bound for negative controls   t.poor = 10,    # upper count bound for negative controls   t.well = 100,   # lower count bound for positive controls   clusters) res <- assessNormalization(   raw=raw.counts,   normalized  = normalized,   negControls = controls$negControls,   posControls = controls$posControls,   clusters    = clusters)

what: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: Applies single multiple normalization methods given data.   Available methods : Total Count (TC) Upper Quartile (UQ) Median (median) Trimmed Median Means (TMM) DESeq PoissonSeq Quantile Normalization (QN) Remove Unwanted Variation (RUVg, RUVr, RUVs)

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: data Un-normalized count data set shape n x p, n number samples p number markers. groups Vector length n maps samples sample groups. method Vector normalization methods applied data. Available methods : c("TC", "UQ", "median", "TMM", "DESeq", "PoissonSeq", "QN", "RUV"). Select one multiple methods. default normalization methods applied.

title: Applies normalization methods to given data set — applyNormalization
text: List normalized read counts selected normalization methods.

what: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment

title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). rows columns count matrix must named, rownames(raw) marker names colnames(raw) sample names. normalized Named list normalized count matrices. matrix holds normalized read count matrix corresponding normalization method study. list member must named (e.g. used normalization). matrix normalized must named row names marker names column names sample names. list normalized counts can generated using applyNormalization function. negControls Vector negative control markers generated function defineControls. posControls Vector positive control markers generated function defineControls. clusters Named Vector clusters. Associates miRNA raw polycistronic cluster. Usually generated using function defineClusters.

title: Data-driven miRNA sequencing Normalization Assessment — assessNormalization
text: DANA Assessment metrics provided normalized counts (  normalized count matrix).   DANA computes two assessment metrics: cc cc measures preservation biological signals   versus normalization.   high value indicates high preservation biological signals   (cc <= 1).   particular, cc concordance correlation coefficient   within-cluster partial correlation among positive controls   normalization. mscr mscr measures relative reduction handling   versus normalization. high mscr indicates higher   removal handling effects.   particular, mscr mean-squared correlation reduction   negative controls normalization. selecting normalization method raw data, one aim best possible trade-hight cc high mscr.

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: Plots histogram marker-specific mean log2-transformed read counts. Bounds definition positive negative controls can highlighted vertical lines (given).

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
code: plotCountHist(raw, binwidth = 0.1, tZero, tPoor, tWell, title)

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: raw Raw read count matrix (rows = genes, cols = samples). tZero Optional. Lower bound negative controls. tPoor Optional. Upper bound negative controls. tWell Optional. Lower bound positive controls. title Plot title xlim.max Upper limit x-axis ylim.max Upper limit y-axis

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
text: ggplot object read count histogram

title: Read count histogram — plotCountHist
code: counts <- matrix(rnbinom(1000, mu=3, size=0.01), nrow=50) plotCountHist(counts)

what: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: Plot function scatter plot DANA result metrics generated using DANA normalization assessment assessNormalization. DANA Assessment metrics given normalized counts (normalized count matrix) provided data.frame columns: cc cc measures preservation biological signals   versus normalization.   high value indicates high preservation biological signals   (cc <= 1) mscr mscr measures relative reduction handling   versus normalization. high mscr indicates higher   removal handling effects. selecting normalization method raw data, one aim best possible trade-hight cc high mscr. function generates ggplot scatter plot DANA metrics selection suitable normalization method.

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
code: plotDANA(   metrics,   label.size = 3,   label.repel = FALSE,   fixed.limits.x = TRUE,   fixed.limits.y = TRUE )

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: metrics data.frame DANA metrics containing metrics cc mscr columns. row represents normalization method. label.size Optional. Text size plot labels. label.repel Optional. Logical ggrepel package used space point labels. Requires package ggrepel installed. fixed.limits.x Optional. Logical limits x-axis (mscr-) fixed [0,1] fixed.limits.y Optional. Logical limits y-axis (cc+) fixed [0,1]

title: Scatter plot DANA assessment metrics — plotDANA
text: ggplot object scatter plot given DANA metrics.
